____________________________________________________________

From voluntarism to paid work

Author: Martin, Mary; Flagler, Susan McGrath; Lewis, Ann D; Murphy, Mary; et al

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389117?accountid=14667

Abstract: Graduates of a 1970s training program for women demonstrated that they had expanded the social change and voluntarism agenda of their earlier training to incorporate feminism and personal action in the workplace. They mirror the oddity of American feminism in defining even social change in individualistic terms.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=From+voluntarism+to+paid+work&amp;rft.au=Martin%2C+Mary%3BFlagler%2C+Susan+McGrath%3BLewis%2C+Ann+D%3BMurphy%2C+Mary%3Bet+al&amp;rft.aulast=Martin&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=1993-04-01&amp;rft.volume=8&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=56&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Solitude in old age: Effects of female headship on elderly women's lives

Author: Ozawa, Martha N

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215384970?accountid=14667

Abstract: The projected living arrangements of women in the year 2030 and the current problems of female heads of families are discussed. Speculation on the living conditions of women who will reach old age in early decades of the 21st century is offered.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Solitude+in+old+age%3A+Effects+of+female+headship+on+elderly+women%27s+lives&amp;rft.au=Ozawa%2C+Martha+N&amp;rft.aulast=Ozawa&amp;rft.aufirst=Martha&amp;rft.date=1993-07-01&amp;rft.volume=8&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=136&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Women, work, and babies: Family-labor market policies in three European countries

Author: Spakes, Patricia

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215399113?accountid=14667

Abstract: An analysis of the family-labor market policies of three European countries--Sweden, the former East Germany, and the former West Germany--contends that the major influences on such policies are the labor needs of the economic system.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women%2C+work%2C+and+babies%3A+Family-labor+market+policies+in+three+European+countries&amp;rft.au=Spakes%2C+Patricia&amp;rft.aulast=Spakes&amp;rft.aufirst=Patricia&amp;rft.date=1995-12-01&amp;rft.volume=10&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=369&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Women of the shadows: Appalachian women's participation in the informal economy

Author: McInnis-Dittrich, Kathleen

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215399052?accountid=14667

Abstract: A qualitative study of 23 Appalachian women identified four patterns of participation in the informal economy. The unique needs of these women illustrate the necessity for differential approaches to welfare reform.

____________________________________________________________

Reflection

Author: Meyer, Carol H11 School Social Work Columbia U, New York NY 10027

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/61599903?accountid=14667

Abstract: In a personal narrative, Meyer's 50 years of social work are described. It is suggested that the current political atmosphere is not supportive of social work, in contrast to the post-WWII period, when an atmosphere of hope encouraged it. It is also noted that social work has become more specialized, & that it is no longer possible for academics or practitioners to have generic competence in social work. It is concluded that shifting epistemologies affecting feminist perspectives & research are two areas currently driving debate in the field of social work. 27 References. J. Ferrari

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Reflection&amp;rft.au=Meyer%2C+Carol+H&amp;rft.aulast=Meyer&amp;rft.aufirst=Carol&amp;rft.date=1996-01-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=408&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Reflection&amp;rft.au=Meyer%2C+Carol+H&amp;rft.aulast=Meyer&amp;rft.aufirst=Carol&amp;rft.date=1996-01-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=408&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Contributing factors to poor health among incarcerated women: A conceptual model

Author: Young, Diane S

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215398787?accountid=14667

Abstract: Young presents a conceptual model that depicts the relevant factors that explain why incarcerated women are generally in poor health. The interrelationships among these factors are explored, and the implications for research and program planning are provided.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Contributing+factors+to+poor+health+among+incarcerated+women%3A+A+conceptual+model&amp;rft.au=Young%2C+Diane+S&amp;rft.aulast=Young&amp;rft.aufirst=Diane&amp;rft.date=1996-12-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=440&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Mandatory HIV testing of newborns: The debate and a programmatic response

Author: Beckerman, Nancy L; Beder, Joan; Gleman, Sheldon R

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392202?accountid=14667

Abstract: A detailed analysis of the complex issues involved in the proposed legislation regarding mandatory HIV testing of all newborns except those whose mothers were tested during pregnancy is presented. Feminist and social work values are considered, given the likely passage of the bill.

Messages from the NGO Forum on Women, Beijing 1995

Author: Roche, Susan E

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215382998?accountid=14667

Abstract: Roche describes two events at the 1995 Nongovernmental Organizations Forum in Beijing in which messages promoting women's rights were presented and discusses how social workers can apply these messages in the US.

Adult survivors of childhood sexual abuse: The case of Mormon women

Author: Gerdes, Karen E; Beck, Martha N; Cowan-Hancock, Sylvia; Wilkinson-Sparks, Tracey

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215383621?accountid=14667

Abstract: Adult survivors of childhood sexual abuse who are members of patriarchal religions face a particular challenge because church teachings and interactions with church members may present barriers to the full recognition and healing of their abuse. Gerdes et al report on a study of the experiences of 71 Mormon women survivors of abuse in their dealings with church leaders and the women's responses to these interactions.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Adult+survivors+of+childhood+sexual+abuse%3A+The+case+of+Mormon+women&amp;rft.au=Gerdes%2C+Karen+E%3BBeck%2C+Martha+N%3BCowan-Hancock%2C+Sylvia%3BWilkinson-Sparks%2C+Tracey&amp;rft.aulast=Gerdes&amp;rft.aufirst=Karen&amp;rft.date=1996-04-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=39&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Women Vietnam veterans with posttraumatic stress disorder: Implications for practice

Author: Price, David H; Knox, Jo

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392436?accountid=14667

Abstract: Price and Knox examine the problems experienced by women veterans of the Vietnam War who suffer from posttraumatic stress disorder, identify practice settings where women veterans are encountered and suggest assessment strategies and therapeutic interventions.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women+Vietnam+veterans+with+posttraumatic+stress+disorder%3A+Implications+for+practice&amp;rft.au=Price%2C+David+H%3BKnox%2C+Jo&amp;rft.aulast=Price&amp;rft.aufirst=David&amp;rft.date=1996-04-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=61&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Rural elderly women's attitudes toward professional and governmental assistance

Author: Butler, Sandra S; DePoy, Elizabeth

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392376?accountid=14667

Abstract: A study is presented that examined the attitudes of 218 rural elderly women toward receiving professional and governmental assistance. The results indicated that although the respondents had little familiarity with governmental programs, they were generally in favor of increased assistance for people in need.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Rural+elderly+women%27s+attitudes+toward+professional+and+governmental+assistance&amp;rft.au=Butler%2C+Sandra+S%3BDePoy%2C+Elizabeth&amp;rft.aulast=Butler&amp;rft.aufirst=Sandra&amp;rft.date=1996-04-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=76&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Changes in the living arrangements, work patterns, and economic status of middle-aged single women: 1971-1991

Author: Choi, Namkee G

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392524?accountid=14667

Abstract: Choi examines the growing tendency of women aged 35-45 to remain single and evaluates the differences in motherhood, living arrangements, educational levels, work experience and economic status of married and single women from 1971 to 1991.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Changes+in+the+living+arrangements%2C+work+patterns%2C+and+economic+status+of+middle-aged+single+women%3A+1971-1991&amp;rft.au=Choi%2C+Namkee+G&amp;rft.aulast=Choi&amp;rft.aufirst=Namkee&amp;rft.date=1996-07-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=164&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Changes+in+the+living+arrangements%2C+work+patterns%2C+and+economic+status+of+middle-aged+single+women%3A+1971-1991&amp;rft.au=Choi%2C+Namkee+G&amp;rft.aulast=Choi&amp;rft.aufirst=Namkee&amp;rft.date=1996-07-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=164&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Women, violence, and fear: One community's experience

Author: Kasper, Barbara; Aponte, Carmen I

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215395907?accountid=14667

Abstract: Kasper and Aponte summarize the findings of a community-based survey of violence against 781 women in the Rochester NY area that was generated by a social action organization and used a participatory research model.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women%2C+violence%2C+and+fear%3A+One+community%27s+experience&amp;rft.au=Kasper%2C+Barbara%3BAponte%2C+Carmen+I&amp;rft.aulast=Kasper&amp;rft.aufirst=Barbara&amp;rft.date=1996-07-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=179&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Identifying gendered outcomes of gender-neutral policies

Author: Quinn, Peggy

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389569?accountid=14667

Abstract: Quinn analyzes two social policies: the Community Mental Health Centers Act of 1963 and the Social Security Amendments of 1983, both of which depend on unstated assumptions that women are informal caretakers.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Identifying+gendered+outcomes+of+gender-neutral+policies&amp;rft.au=Quinn%2C+Peggy&amp;rft.aulast=Quinn&amp;rft.aufirst=Peggy&amp;rft.date=1996-07-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=195&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Author: DePoy, Elizabeth; Butler, Sandra S

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215398671?accountid=14667

Abstract: DePoy and Butler examined how 218 elderly rural women defined and sought to maintain their health and the extent to which social networks, age, endurance, adaptation and proactivity are related to health.

Author: Wetzel, Janice Wood

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393790?accountid=14667

Abstract: Wetzel traces the evolution of the international women's movement through the four international conferences on women that have been held since 1975, paying special attention to the fourth conference, held in China in 1995.

____________________________________________________________

The impact of machismo on Hispanic women

Author: Mayo, Yolanda Quinones; Resnick, Rosa Perla

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215383163?accountid=14667

Abstract: Because of the increasing number of Hispanic women in the United States and their severe socioeconomic, health and mental health needs, it is necessary for social workers to empower these women so they can participate in the mainstream society. The values that Hispanic women bring from their countries of origin, which are dictated by the belief in male superiority and dominance, popularized as machismo and legitimated through patriarchal social systems, are discussed, as well as suggestions for empowering Hispanic women at the micro and macro levels.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=The+impact+of+machismo+on+Hispanic+women&amp;rft.au=Mayo%2C+Yolanda+Quinones%3BResnick%2C+Rosa+Perla&amp;rft.aulast=Mayo&amp;rft.aufirst=Yolanda&amp;rft.date=1996-10-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=257&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=The+impact+of+machismo+on+Hispanic+women&amp;rft.au=Mayo%2C+Yolanda+Quinones%3BResnick%2C+Rosa+Perla&amp;rft.aulast=Mayo&amp;rft.aufirst=Yolanda&amp;rft.date=1996-10-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=257&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Childbearing among unwed African American adolescents: A critique of theories

Author: Stevens, Joyce West

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393655?accountid=14667

Abstract: Although nonmarital births are on the rise for all women, they are disproportionately high for adolescents, especially those who are poor and African American. A critique is presented of the problem of adolescent pregnancy from various theoretical paradigms that argue that the alternate-lifestyle paradigm is a rational explanatory model for the analysis of adolescent pregnancy.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Childbearing+among+unwed+African+American+adolescents%3A+A+critique+of+theories&amp;rft.au=Stevens%2C+Joyce+West&amp;rft.aulast=Stevens&amp;rft.aufirst=Joyce&amp;rft.date=1996-10-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=278&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Childbearing+among+unwed+African+American+adolescents%3A+A+critique+of+theories&amp;rft.au=Stevens%2C+Joyce+West&amp;rft.aulast=Stevens&amp;rft.aufirst=Joyce&amp;rft.date=1996-10-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=278&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Group work with Bedouin widows of the Negev in a medical clinic

Author: Al-Krenawi, Alean

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215402111?accountid=14667

Abstract: In Israel, Bedouin widows who have settled in villages often have few resources to sustain their well-being. A culturally sensitive widows' support group that was set up in a medical clinic to help these women deal with material and personal hardships is discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Group+work+with+Bedouin+widows+of+the+Negev+in+a+medical+clinic&amp;rft.au=Al-Krenawi%2C+Alean&amp;rft.aulast=Al-Krenawi&amp;rft.aufirst=Alean&amp;rft.date=1996-10-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=303&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Group+work+with+Bedouin+widows+of+the+Negev+in+a+medical+clinic&amp;rft.au=Al-Krenawi%2C+Alean&amp;rft.aulast=Al-Krenawi&amp;rft.aufirst=Alean&amp;rft.date=1996-10-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=303&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Stereotypes and stigma: What's changed for welfare mothers

Author: Davis, Liane V; Hagen, Jan L

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215395592?accountid=14667

Abstract: In the debate on welfare reform, stereotypes of women on welfare have resurfaced, and most proposals for reform are designed to modify and regulate women's behaviors. The ways that women manage the stigma of being welfare mothers and what they think about "cheating" the system are discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Stereotypes+and+stigma%3A+What%27s+changed+for+welfare+mothers&amp;rft.au=Davis%2C+Liane+V%3BHagen%2C+Jan+L&amp;rft.aulast=Davis&amp;rft.aufirst=Liane&amp;rft.date=1996-10-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=319&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Wilderness stationery: Women's letters and women's research

Author: Matthews, Carol; Callahan, Marilyn

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392282?accountid=14667

Abstract: The possibilities that letters hold for documenting women's experiences and the implications for feminist research and social work practice are discussed. It is proposed that letter writing is a promising practice and research tool for feminist social workers who are attempting to build egalitarian relationships.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Wilderness+stationery%3A+Women%27s+letters+and+women%27s+research&amp;rft.au=Matthews%2C+Carol%3BCallahan%2C+Marilyn&amp;rft.aulast=Matthews&amp;rft.aufirst=Carol&amp;rft.date=1996-10-01&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=338&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Social work research: Is there a feminist method?

Author: Mason, Sally

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215395227?accountid=14667

Abstract: Mason examines whether social work feminist researchers have reached a consensus about the "best" method for upholding feminist principles by reviewing the research literature for the application of those principles, especially in methodology.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Social+work+research%3A+Is+there+a+feminist+method%3F&amp;rft.au=Mason%2C+Sally&amp;rft.aulast=Mason&amp;rft.aufirst=Sally&amp;rft.date=1997-04-01&amp;rft.volume=12&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=10&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Empowering research participants

Author: Massat, Carol Rippey; Lundy, Marta

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215387535?accountid=14667

Abstract: Massat and Lundy present four principles for empowering research participants using social work ethics and values and feminist principles, each of which includes examples of practical applications from a federally funded research project.

Conducting qualitative interviews with women survivors of trauma

Author: Brzuzy, Stephanie; Ault, Amber; Segal, Elizabeth A

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215382823?accountid=14667

Abstract: It is important for qualitative interviewers to explore and chronicle victimization and trauma without raising the women's anxiety unnecessarily or revictimizing the women. Brzuzy et al discuss concerns related to interviewing women survivors of trauma and present guidelines for interviewing them.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Conducting+qualitative+interviews+with+women+survivors+of+trauma&amp;rft.au=Brzuzy%2C+Stephanie%3BAult%2C+Amber%3BSegal%2C+Elizabeth+A&amp;rft.aulast=Brzuzy&amp;rft.aufirst=Stephanie&amp;rft.date=1997-04-01&amp;rft.volume=12&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=76&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Lesbians' experiences with helping professionals

Author: Tiemann, Kathleen A; Kennedy, Sally A; Haga, Myrna P

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215398319?accountid=14667

Abstract: In in-depth interviews, eight lesbians talked about their interactions with social workers and other helping professionals and how they felt about their experiences. The themes that emerged included the fear of rejection and the need for feelings of safety and trust and for further education of professionals that affirms lesbians' lives.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Lesbians%27+experiences+with+helping+professionals&amp;rft.au=Tiemann%2C+Kathleen+A%3BKennedy%2C+Sally+A%3BHaga%2C+Myrna+P&amp;rft.aulast=Tiemann&amp;rft.aufirst=Kathleen&amp;rft.date=1997-04-01&amp;rft.volume=12&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=84&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Author: Goldberg, Joan E

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393377?accountid=14667

Gender and psychiatry: Psychiatric conceptions of mental disorders in women, 1960-1994

Author: Jimenez, Mary Ann

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215401748?accountid=14667

Abstract: Jimenez's examination of the evolution of psychiatric thought about women from 1960 to 1994 found that a psychological model has largely replaced the biological model that dominated earlier psychiatric thought.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Gender+and+psychiatry%3A+Psychiatric+conceptions+of+mental+disorders+in+women%2C+1960-1994&amp;rft.au=Jimenez%2C+Mary+Ann&amp;rft.aulast=Jimenez&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=1997-07-01&amp;rft.volume=12&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=154&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Nannie Helen Burroughs: A progressive example for modern times

Author: Perkins, Lolita C

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393204?accountid=14667

Abstract: Perkins describes the life and work of Nannie Helen Burroughs, a black activist leader during the Progressive Era of the early 20th century. Women can use Burroughs' work as a model for improving the conditions of poor people and minority groups in the US.

Author: Haslett, Diane C

Female protection and empowerment: Travelers aid services, 1919-1934

Author: Stadum, Beverly

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215401645?accountid=14667

Abstract: A case study of travelers aid services for women in Duluth MN, at a time when social work was redefining its mission nationally, illustrates the diversity among female clients' goals, the services they received, and the importance of home in expectations for them.

____________________________________________________________

Feminist community organizing on a college campus

Author: Martell, Diane; Avitabile, Nancy E

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215394290?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article illustrates the application and evaluation of feminist community organizing principles by a college women's center during a conservative backlash: the early to mid-1990s. It describes how the students organized around the issue of sexual assault on their campus, analyzes the power of the backlash to hinder organizing efforts, and discusses why feminist community organizing is important for women.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Feminist+community+organizing+on+a+college+campus&amp;rft.au=Martell%2C+Diane%3BAvitabile%2C+Nancy+E&amp;rft.aulast=Martell&amp;rft.aufirst=Diane&amp;rft.date=1998-12-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=393&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Feminist+community+organizing+on+a+college+campus&amp;rft.au=Martell%2C+Diane%3BAvitabile%2C+Nancy+E&amp;rft.aulast=Martell&amp;rft.aufirst=Diane&amp;rft.date=1998-12-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=393&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Subject: Feminism; College students; Women; Activism; Sex crimes

____________________________________________________________

"What it was won't be anymore": Reaching the turning point in coping with intimate violence

Author: Eisikovits, Zvi; Buchbinder, Eli; Mor, Michal

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215401117?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article presents a study of the experiences of 20 battered Israeli women in the process of reaching the turning point in their experience of abuse--the point at which they refused to live with violence and took active steps to stop it while living with the perpetrators. The process needs to be understood as a series of losses on the personal and interpersonal levels that, taken together, lead to a total change in the women's meaning systems.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=%22What+it+was+won%27t+be+anymore%22%3A+Reaching+the+turning+point+in+coping+with+intimate+violence&amp;rft.au=Eisikovits%2C+Zvi%3BBuchbinder%2C+Eli%3BMor%2C+Michal&amp;rft.aulast=Eisikovits&amp;rft.aufirst=Zvi&amp;rft.date=1998-12-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=411&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=%22What+it+was+won%27t+be+anymore%22%3A+Reaching+the+turning+point+in+coping+with+intimate+violence&amp;rft.au=Eisikovits%2C+Zvi%3BBuchbinder%2C+Eli%3BMor%2C+Michal&amp;rft.aulast=Eisikovits&amp;rft.aufirst=Zvi&amp;rft.date=1998-12-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=411&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Subject: Domestic violence; Women; Psychology

Comparisons of rural and urban homeless women

Author: Cummins, Linda K; First, Richard J; Toomey, Beverly G

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215394774?accountid=14667

Abstract: This study explores the characteristics, coping patterns, and personal problems of 473 homeless women in 21 randomly selected rural counties in Ohio. Most of the women were homeless without partners and often attributed their homelessness to family conflict and economic hardships.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Comparisons+of+rural+and+urban+homeless+women&amp;rft.au=Cummins%2C+Linda+K%3BFirst%2C+Richard+J%3BToomey%2C+Beverly+G&amp;rft.aulast=Cummins&amp;rft.aufirst=Linda&amp;rft.date=1998-12-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=435&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Correlates of stress among African American nuns

Author: Bryant, Shirley

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390760?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article presents the findings of an exploratory study of the stress experienced by 72 African American nuns. The study found that the less satisfied the nuns were with their religious congregations and the less healthy they felt, the more stress they reported.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Correlates+of+stress+among+African+American+nuns&amp;rft.au=Bryant%2C+Shirley&amp;rft.aulast=Bryant&amp;rft.aufirst=Shirley&amp;rft.date=1998-12-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=454&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Domestic violence gun ban: An analysis of interest-group conflict

Author: Morgan, Suzanne; Nackerud, Larry; Yegidis, Bonnie

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390862?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article analyzes the conflict between two interest groups--advocates for battered women and advocates for law enforcement personnel--that has arisen over P.L. 104-208, which prohibits those who have been convicted of domestic violence from possessing and carrying guns. The article describes the evolution of responses to domestic violence, presents a brief history of the battered women's movement, and discusses the stances of the two interest groups in relation to public policy.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Domestic+violence+gun+ban%3A+An+analysis+of+interest-group+conflict&amp;rft.au=Morgan%2C+Suzanne%3BNackerud%2C+Larry%3BYegidis%2C+Bonnie&amp;rft.aulast=Morgan&amp;rft.aufirst=Suzanne&amp;rft.date=1998-12-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=474&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Toward an alternative account of feminist practice ethics in mental health

Author: Rossiter, Amy

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215397569?accountid=14667

Abstract: The narrative of theoretical work on feminist psychotherapy assumes that the therapeutic relationship is potentially benign, yet feminists in public practice must assume that therapy has the potential for malignancy.

____________________________________________________________

Occupational Status Differences Among Three Groups of Married Mothers

Author: Secret, Mary; Green, Robert G

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/811220514?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article reports on a study of differences in the psychological and social well-being, spousal support, and job satisfaction of three groups of married mothers: those who were employed full-time in professional- managerial occupations, those who were employed full-time in work ing-class/blue-collar occupations, and those who were not employed. The results suggest the need to address differences in occupational status in future studies and to ensure that the needs of working class/blue-collar mothers receive particular consideration in policies and programs.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Occupational+Status+Differences+Among+Three+Groups+of+Married+Mothers&amp;rft.au=Secret%2C+Mary%3BGreen%2C+Robert+G&amp;rft.aulast=Secret&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=1998-04-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=47&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1177%2F088610999801300104

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Occupational+Status+Differences+Among+Three+Groups+of+Married+Mothers&amp;rft.au=Secret%2C+Mary%3BGreen%2C+Robert+G&amp;rft.aulast=Secret&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=1998-04-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=47&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1177%2F088610999801300104

Gender and German unification

Author: Trzcinski, Eileen

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215398000?accountid=14667

Abstract: Trzcinski examines how past and present labor market policies and family policies have interacted to shape labor market opportunities for women from the former German Democratic Republic since the unification of Germany and why German social and economic policies have failed to protect unemployed east German women and their families from economic hardship since unification.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Gender+and+German+unification&amp;rft.au=Trzcinski%2C+Eileen&amp;rft.aulast=Trzcinski&amp;rft.aufirst=Eileen&amp;rft.date=1998-04-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=69&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Gender+and+German+unification&amp;rft.au=Trzcinski%2C+Eileen&amp;rft.aulast=Trzcinski&amp;rft.aufirst=Eileen&amp;rft.date=1998-04-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=69&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Race, gender, and class: Interlocking oppressions in the lives of South Asian women in Canada

Author: George, Usha; Ramkissoon, Sarah

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215401386?accountid=14667

Abstract: George and Ramkissoon find that South Asian women who were recent immigrants to Canada face many challenges in settling in the new country and barriers to the receipt of social services.

Women's perceptions of the glass ceiling in human service organizations and what to do about it

Author: Gibelman, Margaret

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215391324?accountid=14667

Abstract: Gibelman analyzes the responses of women in focus groups who experienced or observed the glass ceiling in human service organizations. A look at their views of the organizational practices that affect the recruitment, hiring and promotion of women and the larger societal implications of the findings is presented.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women%27s+perceptions+of+the+glass+ceiling+in+human+service+organizations+and+what+to+do+about+it&amp;rft.au=Gibelman%2C+Margaret&amp;rft.aulast=Gibelman&amp;rft.aufirst=Margaret&amp;rft.date=1998-07-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=147&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

The relationship between attitudes: Homophobia and sexism among social work students

Author: Black, Beverly; Oles, Thomas P; Moore, Linda

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215394621?accountid=14667

Abstract: Information on a study of the relationship between students' attitudes toward women and toward gay men and lesbians and changes in those attitudes during social work courses at two universities is presented.

Author: Risley-Curtiss, Christina; Hudson, Walter W

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215403530?accountid=14667

____________________________________________________________

Income packaging as a survival strategy for welfare mothers

Author: Miranne, Kristine B

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215397462?accountid=14667

Abstract: Miranne argues that most women, including welfare recipients, package income, meaning they combine resources from men, the market and the state to support their families. Accepting the concept of income packaging and incorporating it into social welfare policies would reduce the stigma attached to the receipt of welfare and would decrease the dependence of poor women and their families on welfare benefits.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Income+packaging+as+a+survival+strategy+for+welfare+mothers&amp;rft.au=Miranne%2C+Kristine+B&amp;rft.aulast=Miranne&amp;rft.aufirst=Kristine&amp;rft.date=1998-07-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=211&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Women in prison: Approaches to understanding the lives of a forgotten population

Author: McQuaide, Sharon; Ehrenreich, John H

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215391415?accountid=14667

Abstract: McQuaide and Ehrenreich review the literature on women inmates in state and federal prisons and present research directions and strategies that can capture both the commonalities and differences in the women's experiences.

In-dependence: A feminist postmodern deconstruction

Author: East, Jean F

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215397368?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article uses a feminist postmodern perspective to analyze the meanings of dependence, both psychological and economic, as they are applied to women, particularly those who are of low income.

Honoring voice and visibility: Sensitive-topic research and feminist interpretive inquiry

Author: Jansen, Golie G; Davis, Diane Rae

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215387060?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article articulates the value and use of feminist interpretive inquiry for research on sensitive topics. It presents examples from two studies of women healing from alcholism and Southeast Asian refugee women who are paraprofessional helpers.

____________________________________________________________

Saints or sinners? The image of social workers from American stage and cinema before World War II

Author: Hiersteiner, Catherine

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215391152?accountid=14667

Abstract: Films and plays produced before World War II portrayed young social workers as fallen angels and older social workers as spinsters or misguided-mother types -- images influenced more by political ideology, the audience factor, and attitudes toward women than by any actual knowledge of the profession.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Saints+or+sinners%3F+The+image+of+social+workers+from+American+stage+and+cinema+before+World+War+II&amp;rft.au=Hiersteiner%2C+Catherine&amp;rft.aulast=Hiersteiner&amp;rft.aufirst=Catherine&amp;rft.date=1998-10-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=312&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Using the moral vision of African American stories to empower low-income African American women

Author: Leslie, Annie Ruth

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215397279?accountid=14667

Abstract: On the basis of in-depth interviews with 30 low-income African American mothers who told their children Brer Rabbit stories, this article discusses the moral values the women conveyed.

Exploiter or exploited: Topless dancers reflect on their experiences

Author: Bell, Holly; Sloan, Lacey; Strickling, Chris

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215382049?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article presents a secondary analysis of interviews with 30 current and former topless dancers, focusing on references to their experiences of stigma and exploitation. No dancers expressed the opinion that dancers alone were exploited by topless dancing.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Exploiter+or+exploited%3A+Topless+dancers+reflect+on+their+experiences&amp;rft.au=Bell%2C+Holly%3BSloan%2C+Lacey%3BStrickling%2C+Chris&amp;rft.aulast=Bell&amp;rft.aufirst=Holly&amp;rft.date=1998-10-01&amp;rft.volume=13&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=352&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Helping clients, helping ourselves: A social work agenda for achieving occupational equity

Author: Gibelman, Margaret

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390493?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article explores the glass-ceiling barriers and pay inequities experienced by women who are employed in the nonprofit human services. In addition, it reviews past and current initiatives to ameliorate gender discrimination and discrepancies between equal opportunity policies and continued marketplace realities and presents implications for policy development, social action, research, and practice.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Helping+clients%2C+helping+ourselves%3A+A+social+work+agenda+for+achieving+occupational+equity&amp;rft.au=Gibelman%2C+Margaret&amp;rft.aulast=Gibelman&amp;rft.aufirst=Margaret&amp;rft.date=1999-12-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=400&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Ethnic and lesbian: Understanding identity through the life-history approach

Author: Brotman, Shari; Kraniou, Stavroula

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390010?accountid=14667

Abstract: Canadian lesbians of ethnic ancestry experience many identity struggles as a result of being in multiple situations within both their own ethnic communities and their chosen lesbian communities. The case study presented here used a life-history approach to explore these dynamics. The life and experiences of one lesbian of ethnic ancestry are examined to highlight the usefulness of the life-history method in uncovering the complex realities that ethnic lesbians face in the creation of their subjective identities.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Ethnic+and+lesbian%3A+Understanding+identity+through+the+life-history+approach&amp;rft.au=Brotman%2C+Shari%3BKraniou%2C+Stavroula&amp;rft.aulast=Brotman&amp;rft.aufirst=Shari&amp;rft.date=1999-12-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=417&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Battered women and their children: A public policy response

Author: Owens-Manley, Judith

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215386369?accountid=14667

Abstract: Domestic violence has long been acknowledged as an issue in intimate relationships but treated as a private, rather than a public, problem. As fewer federal funds are made available and more fiscal responsibility is shifted to state governments, the states' policies will become more and more critical.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Battered+women+and+their+children%3A+A+public+policy+response&amp;rft.au=Owens-Manley%2C+Judith&amp;rft.aulast=Owens-Manley&amp;rft.aufirst=Judith&amp;rft.date=1999-12-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=439&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Feminist links, postmodern interruptions: Critical pedagogy and social work

Author: Pennell, Joan; Ristock, Janice L

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390100?accountid=14667

Abstract: Postmodern perspectives can constructively interrupt conventional views as long as social workers remain linked to feminist and other intersecting emancipatory movements. This article deconstructs the dichotomy between science and practice and presents a class exercise to illustrate how an analysis of feminist links-postmodern interruptions can promote a self-critical and proactive education in foundation courses for largely female students in historically marginalized regions of Canada and the United States.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Feminist+links%2C+postmodern+interruptions%3A+Critical+pedagogy+and+social+work&amp;rft.au=Pennell%2C+Joan%3BRistock%2C+Janice+L&amp;rft.aulast=Pennell&amp;rft.aufirst=Joan&amp;rft.date=1999-12-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=460&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Applying relational theory to the treatment of women's addictions

Author: Zelvin, Elizabeth

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215400957?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article discusses the application of relational theory to the treatment of women's addictions. It compares traditional models with relational models, and it discusses the relevance of relational theory to women's addictions and codependency issues.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Applying+relational+theory+to+the+treatment+of+women%27s+addictions&amp;rft.au=Zelvin%2C+Elizabeth&amp;rft.aulast=Zelvin&amp;rft.aufirst=Elizabeth&amp;rft.date=1999-04-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=9&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Las Comadres as a social support system

Author: Lopez, Rebecca A

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390913?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article explores the relationship among 38 Latinas who participated in the fictive kin system of compadrazgo, or coparenthood. This system encourages the sharing of child-rearing responsibilities among parents and acquired godparents.

Working and nonworking women: Onset of homelessness within the context of their lives

Author: Johnson, Alice K

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215400438?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article reports on qualitative interviews with 25 women who were former residents of an emergency shelter. The interviews used a personal narrative approach to place the onset of homelessness within the context of the women's lives.

The nature and function of fusion in the dynamics of lesbian relationships

Author: Greene, Kathryn; Causby, Vickie; Miller, Diane Helene

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215388370?accountid=14667

Abstract: Although much has been written about the problem of fusion in relationships, especially among lesbians, there is little evidence of its prevalence in the nonclinical lesbian community or information about the function it may serve in lesbian relationships. This study examined the frequency effusion in lesbian and heterosexual women's relationships and the relationship of fusion to other relational variables.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=The+nature+and+function+of+fusion+in+the+dynamics+of+lesbian+relationships&amp;rft.au=Greene%2C+Kathryn%3BCausby%2C+Vickie%3BMiller%2C+Diane+Helene&amp;rft.aulast=Greene&amp;rft.aufirst=Kathryn&amp;rft.date=1999-04-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=78&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=The+nature+and+function+of+fusion+in+the+dynamics+of+lesbian+relationships&amp;rft.au=Greene%2C+Kathryn%3BCausby%2C+Vickie%3BMiller%2C+Diane+Helene&amp;rft.aulast=Greene&amp;rft.aufirst=Kathryn&amp;rft.date=1999-04-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=78&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Blending work and family: A case study

Author: Sprang, Ginny; Secret, Mary; Bradford, Judith

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215381885?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article describes an employer-based infant-care program that is a unique response to the needs of working parents. This parenting-at-work option allows mothers to blend the often-competing demands of work and family and provides high-quality child care to their infants in the workplace.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Blending+work+and+family%3A+A+case+study&amp;rft.au=Sprang%2C+Ginny%3BSecret%2C+Mary%3BBradford%2C+Judith&amp;rft.aulast=Sprang&amp;rft.aufirst=Ginny&amp;rft.date=1999-04-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=98&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Author: Peebles-Wilkins, Wilma

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215400568?accountid=14667

Abstract: Political considerations that both led to a focus on personal responsibility and culminated in current welfare-to-work programs involved early discussions and punitive proposals for the care of welfare dependent children. Social work advocacy groups lobbied extensively and developed reactive positions in response to these proposals.

Author: Hiersteiner, Catherine; Peterson, K Jean

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215397047?accountid=14667

Abstract: Mary Richmond, Mary Jarrett, Jessie Taft, Virginia Robinson, and Bertha Reynolds were five eminent scholar-practitioners from the pre-World War II era who shaped American social work philosophy and practice.

Restructuring resilience: Emerging voices

Author: Bachay, Judith B; Cingel, Pamela A

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215394040?accountid=14667

Abstract: This study presents a qualitative analysis of the subjective voice of minority women in which the women revealed three constitutional factors that enhanced their resilience: strong measures of self-efficacy, well-defined faith lives, and the ability to reframe barriers and obstacles.

Employment and the use of welfare among male and female heads of AFDC households

Author: Hardina, Donna

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215388240?accountid=14667

Abstract: Studies have found that single mothers on welfare rarely find full-time, permanent jobs at adequate wages, but few have examined the impact of gender on the likelihood that welfare recipients will leave welfare and find employment.

____________________________________________________________

A feminist analysis of welfare reform: The Personal Responsibility Act of 1996

Author: Jimenez, Mary Ann

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215388164?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article presents a feminist analysis of the Personal Responsibility Act of 1996, which ended women's and children's federal entitlement to welfare. It draws on the congressional hearings preceding the act's passage to argue that the act was crafted to discipline poor women who seemed to challenge traditional gender roles and deep-seated values about women's place in American society.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=A+feminist+analysis+of+welfare+reform%3A+The+Personal+Responsibility+Act+of+1996&amp;rft.au=Jimenez%2C+Mary+Ann&amp;rft.aulast=Jimenez&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=1999-10-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=278&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=A+feminist+analysis+of+welfare+reform%3A+The+Personal+Responsibility+Act+of+1996&amp;rft.au=Jimenez%2C+Mary+Ann&amp;rft.aulast=Jimenez&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=1999-10-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=278&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Time limits under temporary assistance to needy families: A look at the welfare cliff

Author: Hagen, Jan L

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215403184?accountid=14667

Abstract: Temporary Assistance to Needy Families, which replaced Aid to Families with Dependent Children in 1996, ended federal entitlement to cash assistance for poor women and their children and established a welfare cliff -- a 5-year, lifetime limit for receiving assistance from federal funds. This article discusses the implications of time limits for the development of state programs and for the lives of poor women and their children.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Time+limits+under+temporary+assistance+to+needy+families%3A+A+look+at+the+welfare+cliff&amp;rft.au=Hagen%2C+Jan+L&amp;rft.aulast=Hagen&amp;rft.aufirst=Jan&amp;rft.date=1999-10-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=294&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Teaching students about collaborative approaches to organizational change

Author: O'Connor, Mary Katherine; Netting, F Ellen

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215396938?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article explores the implications of teaching students about collaborative practice in organizations and how collaboration in making changes requires finding and developing alternative models to traditional approaches. It discusses the limits of models of planned change that are taught in organizational practice, identifies the underlying assumptions of collaborative approaches to change, and proposes a beginning framework for teaching students how to use collaborative change in organizations.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Teaching+students+about+collaborative+approaches+to+organizational+change&amp;rft.au=O%27Connor%2C+Mary+Katherine%3BNetting%2C+F+Ellen&amp;rft.aulast=O%27Connor&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=1999-10-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=315&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

African American grandmothers: New mothers again

Author: Gibson, Priscilla A

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215396840?accountid=14667

Abstract: This qualitative study captured the lived experiences of 12 grandmothers who assumed the role of primary caregivers of their grandchildren because the children's parents were not present. The study found that the grandmothers experienced a role shift from grandmothers to new mothers again, which resulted in unanticipated changes in all aspects of their lives.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=African+American+grandmothers%3A+New+mothers+again&amp;rft.au=Gibson%2C+Priscilla+A&amp;rft.aulast=Gibson&amp;rft.aufirst=Priscilla&amp;rft.date=1999-10-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=329&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Women's issues and social work accreditation: A status report

Author: Bentley, Kia J; Valentine, Deborah; Haskett, George

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215396761?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article highlights the challenges inherent in bringing a feminist perspective to women's issues in a woman's profession, it also reviews efforts by the Council on Social Work Education's Commission on the Role and Status of Women to determine how the accreditation process is perceived as a vehicle for improving the conditions and addressing the gender-based concerns of women faculty and students and increasing the inclusion of women's content in the curriculum.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women%27s+issues+and+social+work+accreditation%3A+A+status+report&amp;rft.au=Bentley%2C+Kia+J%3BValentine%2C+Deborah%3BHaskett%2C+George&amp;rft.aulast=Bentley&amp;rft.aufirst=Kia&amp;rft.date=1999-10-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=344&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women%27s+issues+and+social+work+accreditation%3A+A+status+report&amp;rft.au=Bentley%2C+Kia+J%3BValentine%2C+Deborah%3BHaskett%2C+George&amp;rft.aulast=Bentley&amp;rft.aufirst=Kia&amp;rft.date=1999-10-01&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=344&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Title: Women's issues and social work accreditation: A status report

Publication title: Affilia

Volume: 14

Issue: 3

Feminist voices on sex work: Implications for social work

Author: Sloan, Lacey; Wahab, Stephanie

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215399716?accountid=14667

Abstract: Sex work and prostitution are the focus of debate among feminists. Sloan and Wahab explore the long history of the debate on sex work and present recommendations for a policy statement for the profession.

____________________________________________________________

The dynamics of battering revisited

Author: Chornesky, Alice

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392005?accountid=14667

Abstract: There is no agreement on the theories that attempt to explain the abuse of women by their partners or spouses. Chornesky uses attachment theory and theories of connection and relationship to examine the causes of spousal violence and the tendency for abusive relationships to persist.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=The+dynamics+of+battering+revisited&amp;rft.au=Chornesky%2C+Alice&amp;rft.aulast=Chornesky&amp;rft.aufirst=Alice&amp;rft.date=2000-12-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=480&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Continuing to care: Black and Latina daughters' assistance to their mothers in nursing homes

Author: Kolb, Patricia J

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389506?accountid=14667

Abstract: Interviews with Black and Latina daughters who were caregivers for their mothers in a nursing home revealed the daughters' tasks, motivations and emotional responses to caregiving. These tasks, motivations and emotional responses are discussed from the perspective of racial-ethnic feminist theories and prior research on caregiving, gender and ethnicity.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Continuing+to+care%3A+Black+and+Latina+daughters%27+assistance+to+their+mothers+in+nursing+homes&amp;rft.au=Kolb%2C+Patricia+J&amp;rft.aulast=Kolb&amp;rft.aufirst=Patricia&amp;rft.date=2000-12-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=502&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Mortgage lending and gender

Author: Sanders, Cynthia K; Scanlon, Edward

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215400109?accountid=14667

Abstract: Sanders and Scanlon share their surprising finding that men are slightly more likely than women to be denied conventional mortgage loans.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Mortgage+lending+and+gender&amp;rft.au=Sanders%2C+Cynthia+K%3BScanlon%2C+Edward&amp;rft.aulast=Sanders&amp;rft.aufirst=Cynthia&amp;rft.date=2000-04-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=9&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Marginalized epistemologies: A feminist approach to understanding the experiences of mothers with HIV

Author: Tangenberg, Kathleen

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390417?accountid=14667

Abstract: Tangenberg reports on an exploratory study of the privileging and marginalization of spiritual and bodily knowledge identified in the transcripts of focus group meetings of mothers with HIV.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Marginalized+epistemologies%3A+A+feminist+approach+to+understanding+the+experiences+of+mothers+with+HIV&amp;rft.au=Tangenberg%2C+Kathleen&amp;rft.aulast=Tangenberg&amp;rft.aufirst=Kathleen&amp;rft.date=2000-04-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=31&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Wayward girls and virtuous women: Social workers and female juvenile delinquency in the progressive era

Author: Abrams, Laura S; Curran, Laura

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392344?accountid=14667

Abstract: Abrams and Curran discuss social workers' relationships to practices that criminalized adolescent female sexuality in the Progressive Era by examining two branches of the burgeoning profession: the social reformers and the caseworkers.

Author: Carlton-LaNey, Iris

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215381511?accountid=14667

Abstract: Carlton-LaNey focuses on the strategic importance of the roles of African American and White women in establishing the Good Samaritan Hospital in Charlotte NC in 1891 and on the groups' interracial cooperation in maintaining the hospital.

____________________________________________________________

Rights and wrongs of welfare reform: A feminist approach

Author: Pearce, Diana

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392193?accountid=14667

Abstract: How do feminists frame a critique of welfare reform that supports women's efforts to achieve economic independence without embracing the oppressive nature of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act? By taking a human rights perspective, this article asserts that the success of any welfare program should be evaluated by whether it achieves its fundamental goal of allowing single mothers to keep their children and provide for them adequately.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Rights+and+wrongs+of+welfare+reform%3A+A+feminist+approach&amp;rft.au=Pearce%2C+Diana&amp;rft.aulast=Pearce&amp;rft.aufirst=Diana&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=133&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Rights+and+wrongs+of+welfare+reform%3A+A+feminist+approach&amp;rft.au=Pearce%2C+Diana&amp;rft.aulast=Pearce&amp;rft.aufirst=Diana&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=133&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Supporting the move from welfare to work: What women say

Author: Pearlmutter, Sue; Bartle, Elizabeth E

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215394178?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article presents a focus group study of the perceptions of welfare participants in Cuyahoga County, Ohio, and Los Angeles County, California, of various aspects of welfare, subsidized child care, jobs with living wages, the counties' employment programs, and the participants' relationships with welfare workers. The results suggest that participants are not receiving the support they need to obtain and retain jobs that will lead to self-sustaining careers.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Supporting+the+move+from+welfare+to+work%3A+What+women+say&amp;rft.au=Pearlmutter%2C+Sue%3BBartle%2C+Elizabeth+E&amp;rft.aulast=Pearlmutter&amp;rft.aufirst=Sue&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=153&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Voices of welfare reform: Bureaucratic rationality versus the perceptions of welfare participants

Author: Tickamyer, Ann R; Henderson, Debra A; White, Julie Anne; Tadlock, Barry L

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215387637?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article compares the assumptions of welfare reform with the way the program is actually implemented to show the underlying contradictions in the way policy is politically justified and implemented. The results of focus group discussions with women on welfare in four rural Appalachian Ohio counties demonstrate the disparities between the top-down goals of welfare policy and the bottom-up perceptions of their outcomes.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Voices+of+welfare+reform%3A+Bureaucratic+rationality+versus+the+perceptions+of+welfare+participants&amp;rft.au=Tickamyer%2C+Ann+R%3BHenderson%2C+Debra+A%3BWhite%2C+Julie+Anne%3BTadlock%2C+Barry+L&amp;rft.aulast=Tickamyer&amp;rft.aufirst=Ann&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=173&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Voices+of+welfare+reform%3A+Bureaucratic+rationality+versus+the+perceptions+of+welfare+participants&amp;rft.au=Tickamyer%2C+Ann+R%3BHenderson%2C+Debra+A%3BWhite%2C+Julie+Anne%3BTadlock%2C+Barry+L&amp;rft.aulast=Tickamyer&amp;rft.aufirst=Ann&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=173&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

The vulnerability of American Indian women in the new welfare state

Author: Brzuzy, Stephanie; Stromwall, Layne; Sharp, Polly; Wilson, Regina; Segal, Elizabeth

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215387711?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article focuses on the unequal impact of PRWORA and TANF programs on American Indian women and their children in Arizona, despite exemptions from time limits on high-unemployment reservations. It discusses whether gaming, a controversial form of economic development in tribal communities, is a potential benefit to American Indian women and presents implications for social work practice and advocacy.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=The+vulnerability+of+American+Indian+women+in+the+new+welfare+state&amp;rft.au=Brzuzy%2C+Stephanie%3BStromwall%2C+Layne%3BSharp%2C+Polly%3BWilson%2C+Regina%3BSegal%2C+Elizabeth&amp;rft.aulast=Brzuzy&amp;rft.aufirst=Stephanie&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=193&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Welfare reform and mutual family support: Effects on mother-led Mexican American families

Author: Weinberg, Sylvia B

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215399776?accountid=14667

Abstract: Time limits for the receipt of welfare were imposed on San Antonio's Mexican American mother-led families earlier than for welfare participants in other states. This article examines the effects of this social experiment on an already vulnerable population and addresses the effects of family support, both given and received, on the women's reliance on welfare and on work.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Welfare+reform+and+mutual+family+support%3A+Effects+on+mother-led+Mexican+American+families&amp;rft.au=Weinberg%2C+Sylvia+B&amp;rft.aulast=Weinberg&amp;rft.aufirst=Sylvia&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=204&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/
