____________________________________________________________

Toward real welfare reform: The voices of battered women

Author: Brandwein, Ruth A; Filiano, Diana M

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215386222?accountid=14667

Abstract: Twenty-four battered women who were on welfare were interviewed in five focus groups in two states from 1996 to 1999. The women's revelations of their attempts to work, obstacles to employment, and treatment by the welfare system before and after Temporary Assistance to Needy Families was implemented suggest the need for both short-term and long-term changes in policies.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Toward+real+welfare+reform%3A+The+voices+of+battered+women&amp;rft.au=Brandwein%2C+Ruth+A%3BFiliano%2C+Diana+M&amp;rft.aulast=Brandwein&amp;rft.aufirst=Ruth&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=224&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Analysis of the family violence option: A strengths perspective

Author: Postmus, Judy L

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390326?accountid=14667

Abstract: The Family Violence Option (FVO) provides exemptions from Temporary Assistance to Needy Families requirements to victims of domestic violence. This article examines the link between domestic violence and welfare and analyzes the FVO using the strengths perspective.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Analysis+of+the+family+violence+option%3A+A+strengths+perspective&amp;rft.au=Postmus%2C+Judy+L&amp;rft.aulast=Postmus&amp;rft.aufirst=Judy&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=244&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Moving welfare participants to work: Women, transportation, and welfare reform

Author: Blumenberg, Evelyn

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215381431?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article draws on data for Los Angeles to argue that effective transportation programs for welfare recipients must consider both the distinctive characteristics and patterns of employed women and the constraining burdens of children and other household responsibilities. The failure to do so will limit the effectiveness of these programs and greatly increase the likelihood that recipients will remain poor.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Moving+welfare+participants+to+work%3A+Women%2C+transportation%2C+and+welfare+reform&amp;rft.au=Blumenberg%2C+Evelyn&amp;rft.aulast=Blumenberg&amp;rft.aufirst=Evelyn&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=259&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Facilitating self-esteem and social supports in a family life-skills program

Author: Wichroski, Mary Anne; Zunz, Sharyn J; Forshay, Elizabeth

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215399910?accountid=14667

Abstract: A preliminary study of a statewide life-skills job-readiness program in which 116 female Temporary Assistance to Needy Families recipients participated found that significant gains made in curricular areas were positively correlated with self-esteem and social supports. The responses to a qualitative survey and ethnographic data revealed these women's strengths and the ways in which gender may have facilitated positive outcomes.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Facilitating+self-esteem+and+social+supports+in+a+family+life-skills+program&amp;rft.au=Wichroski%2C+Mary+Anne%3BZunz%2C+Sharyn+J%3BForshay%2C+Elizabeth&amp;rft.aulast=Wichroski&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=277&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Working for equality and economic liberation: Advocacy and education for welfare reform

Author: Finn, Janet L; Castellanos, Raquel; McOmber, Toni; Kahan, Kate

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392106?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article chronicles the history of Working for Equality and Economic Liberation (WEEL), a Montana-based grassroots advocacy and educational organization that emerged in response to welfare reform. It discusses the development of WEEL, the feminist principles that undergird it, and WEEL's accomplishments, challenges, and links to a broad-based network of other groups.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Working+for+equality+and+economic+liberation%3A+Advocacy+and+education+for+welfare+reform&amp;rft.au=Finn%2C+Janet+L%3BCastellanos%2C+Raquel%3BMcOmber%2C+Toni%3BKahan%2C+Kate&amp;rft.aulast=Finn&amp;rft.aufirst=Janet&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=294&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Empowerment through welfare-rights organizing: A feminist perspective

Author: East, Jean F

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215402878?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article describes a community-based welfare reform-welfare rights organizing coalition that is based on a feminist empowerment model of practice. The experiences of women who have participated in the coalition are highlighted, and suggested courses of action for organizing such coalitions are proposed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Empowerment+through+welfare-rights+organizing%3A+A+feminist+perspective&amp;rft.au=East%2C+Jean+F&amp;rft.aulast=East&amp;rft.aufirst=Jean&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=311&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Picture this: Images and realities in welfare to work

Author: Miriam Meltzer Olson; Muhammad, Khadijah; Rodgers, Laura; Karim, Mansura

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215397221?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article is concerned with image making and image manipulation. It examines an advertising campaign to promote the hiring of women who are leaving welfare as a means of understanding the representations of women on welfare in the mass media and in the rhetoric of public officials.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Picture+this%3A+Images+and+realities+in+welfare+to+work&amp;rft.au=Miriam+Meltzer+Olson%3BMuhammad%2C+Khadijah%3BRodgers%2C+Laura%3BKarim%2C+Mansura&amp;rft.aulast=Miriam+Meltzer+Olson&amp;rft.aufirst=&amp;rft.date=2000-07-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=329&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Students' Perceptions of Single Parents and Social Injustice: A Women's Issue

Author: Rhodes, Rita1; Johnson, Miriam McNown1 College of Social Work, University of South Carolina, Columbia, SC 29208

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/813020341?accountid=14667

Abstract: This study examined graduate social work students' perceptions of vulnerable populations. The results suggest that although the students were able to identify oppression as a factor in the lives of women and other at-risk populations, for the most part, their perceptions of single parents underscored the belief that the life conditions of femaleheaded families are the consequence of individual choice, rather than of societal arrangements that have a disproportionately negative impact on women.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Students%27+Perceptions+of+Single+Parents+and+Social+Injustice%3A+A+Women%27s+Issue&amp;rft.au=Rhodes%2C+Rita%3BJohnson%2C+Miriam+McNown&amp;rft.aulast=Rhodes&amp;rft.aufirst=Rita&amp;rft.date=2000-08-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=434&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1177%2F08861090022094038

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Students%27+Perceptions+of+Single+Parents+and+Social+Injustice%3A+A+Women%27s+Issue&amp;rft.au=Rhodes%2C+Rita%3BJohnson%2C+Miriam+McNown&amp;rft.aulast=Rhodes&amp;rft.aufirst=Rita&amp;rft.date=2000-08-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=434&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1177%2F08861090022094038

____________________________________________________________

Pauline Agassiz Shaw, 1841-1917: A forgotten visionary

Author: Hoffman, Norma

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393852?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article describes the life and contributions of Pauline Agassiz Shaw, who pioneered the public kindergarten movement in the United States and was an activist for many social causes, including women's suffrage, prison reform, and world peace.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Pauline+Agassiz+Shaw%2C+1841-1917%3A+A+forgotten+visionary&amp;rft.au=Hoffman%2C+Norma&amp;rft.aulast=Hoffman&amp;rft.aufirst=Norma&amp;rft.date=2000-10-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=360&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Pauline+Agassiz+Shaw%2C+1841-1917%3A+A+forgotten+visionary&amp;rft.au=Hoffman%2C+Norma&amp;rft.aulast=Hoffman&amp;rft.aufirst=Norma&amp;rft.date=2000-10-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=360&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Responding to oppression and abuse: A feminist challenge to clinical social work

Author: Dietz, Christine A

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389696?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article uses feminist micropractice to show how social workers can connect the personal with the political. It discusses the controversy surrounding clinical social work practice; the disempowering and empowering aspects of micropractice approaches; the political context of micropractice; and the viability of feminist, empowerment-oriented approaches to practice in a managed care environment.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Responding+to+oppression+and+abuse%3A+A+feminist+challenge+to+clinical+social+work&amp;rft.au=Dietz%2C+Christine+A&amp;rft.aulast=Dietz&amp;rft.aufirst=Christine&amp;rft.date=2000-10-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=369&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Help seeking for violence: Views of survivors

Author: Van Hook, Mary P

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393931?accountid=14667

Abstract: This study of reports of physical abuse by women in medical clinics identified the barriers to reporting abuse, including time constraints and providers' and patients' attitudes and help-seeking patterns, and the responses that women find most helpful. Feminist principles of organizing--consciousness raising, bottom-up organizing, respect for women's definition of the solution, and awareness of the impact of the political-can help guide interventions with these women.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Help+seeking+for+violence%3A+Views+of+survivors&amp;rft.au=Van+Hook%2C+Mary+P&amp;rft.aulast=Van+Hook&amp;rft.aufirst=Mary&amp;rft.date=2000-10-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=390&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Social action research: Influencing providers and recipients of health and mental health care for lesbians

Author: Christine Flynn Saulnier; Wheeler, Elizabeth

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215394058?accountid=14667

Abstract: From 1994 through 1997, the Lesbian Health Care Project of Western New York (LHCP), a feminist social action research project, gathered region-specific information about lesbians' physical and mental health care. The project conducted a community survey, community focus groups, and a provider survey and developed and distributed a community resource book/directory of providers. This article describes the project and its findings and discusses social action strategies and implications for practice.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Social+action+research%3A+Influencing+providers+and+recipients+of+health+and+mental+health+care+for+lesbians&amp;rft.au=Christine+Flynn+Saulnier%3BWheeler%2C+Elizabeth&amp;rft.aulast=Christine+Flynn+Saulnier&amp;rft.aufirst=&amp;rft.date=2000-10-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=409&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Social+action+research%3A+Influencing+providers+and+recipients+of+health+and+mental+health+care+for+lesbians&amp;rft.au=Christine+Flynn+Saulnier%3BWheeler%2C+Elizabeth&amp;rft.aulast=Christine+Flynn+Saulnier&amp;rft.aufirst=&amp;rft.date=2000-10-01&amp;rft.volume=15&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=409&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Subjugated knowledge in gender-integrated social work education: Call for a dialogue

Author: Figueira-McDonough, Josefina; Netting, F Ellen; Nichols-Casebolt, Ann

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393348?accountid=14667

Abstract: If social work education is truly committed to social justice and self-determination, it will have to liberate the knowledge of gorups with which it works. To do so, it is necessary to recognized the unique role of practitioners in discovering and interpreting subjugated kknowledge, which requires that acedemicians, practitioners, and consumers of services have opportunities to dialogue.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Subjugated+knowledge+in+gender-integrated+social+work+education%3A+Call+for+a+dialogue&amp;rft.au=Figueira-McDonough%2C+Josefina%3BNetting%2C+F+Ellen%3BNichols-Casebolt%2C+Ann&amp;rft.aulast=Figueira-McDonough&amp;rft.aufirst=Josefina&amp;rft.date=2001-12-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=411&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

A wolf in sheep's clothes? How welfare reform may threaten domestic violence services

Author: Smith, Susan E

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215402101?accountid=14667

Abstract: The 1996 welfare reform law threatens the independence and integrity of domestic violence agencies for two reasons: (a) The "work-first" approach may distort their primary mission, especially because victims of domestic violence are at reat risk in the workplace, and (b) these agencies can be considered feminist organizations.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=A+wolf+in+sheep%27s+clothes%3F+How+welfare+reform+may+threaten+domestic+violence+services&amp;rft.au=Smith%2C+Susan+E&amp;rft.aulast=Smith&amp;rft.aufirst=Susan&amp;rft.date=2001-12-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=432&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=A+wolf+in+sheep%27s+clothes%3F+How+welfare+reform+may+threaten+domestic+violence+services&amp;rft.au=Smith%2C+Susan+E&amp;rft.aulast=Smith&amp;rft.aufirst=Susan&amp;rft.date=2001-12-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=432&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

"Sitting with the sick": African American women's philanthropy

Author: Carlton-LaNey, Iris; Hamilton, Jill; Ruiz, Dorothy; Sandra Carlton Alexander

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215391333?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article traces the hisstorical development of informal and, to a less extent, formal health caregiving among African American women form slavery to the Great Depresison. "Sitting with the sick," a metaphor for myriad services, including preparing meals for, housekeeping for, feeding, bathing, and generally visiting with people who are mentally or physically ill, injured, or greiving, has been an important aspect of social support among African American women for centuries.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=%22Sitting+with+the+sick%22%3A+African+American+women%27s+philanthropy&amp;rft.au=Carlton-LaNey%2C+Iris%3BHamilton%2C+Jill%3BRuiz%2C+Dorothy%3BSandra+Carlton+Alexander&amp;rft.aulast=Carlton-LaNey&amp;rft.aufirst=Iris&amp;rft.date=2001-12-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=447&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=%22Sitting+with+the+sick%22%3A+African+American+women%27s+philanthropy&amp;rft.au=Carlton-LaNey%2C+Iris%3BHamilton%2C+Jill%3BRuiz%2C+Dorothy%3BSandra+Carlton+Alexander&amp;rft.aulast=Carlton-LaNey&amp;rft.aufirst=Iris&amp;rft.date=2001-12-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=447&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Women of war: Emotional needs of ethnic Albanians in refugee camps

Author: Drumm, Rene; Pittman, Sharon; Perry, Shelly

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215391408?accountid=14667

Abstract: This qualitative study identified the emotional needs of female Kosovar refugees in souther nalbania in May 1999, about 1 month following their flight from Kosovo. Common themes that emerged from the interviews included dealing with trauma, anxiety, and boredom and maintaining the hope that they would return home.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women+of+war%3A+Emotional+needs+of+ethnic+Albanians+in+refugee+camps&amp;rft.au=Drumm%2C+Rene%3BPittman%2C+Sharon%3BPerry%2C+Shelly&amp;rft.aulast=Drumm&amp;rft.aufirst=Rene&amp;rft.date=2001-12-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=467&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Where do you go when it's 40 below? Domestic violence among rural Alaska native women

Author: Shepherd, Judy

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215380894?accountid=14667

Abstract: Although domestic violence is now recognized as a serious social problem in american society, little information is available on this problem in rural indigenous communities. This article, which is derived from in-depth interviews and 9 rural Alaska Native women who have been in abusive relationships, explores the environmental and cultural context of domestic violence in a remote Alaska Native community and the adaptations that such a context requires for the provision of culturally appropriate services.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Where+do+you+go+when+it%27s+40+below%3F+Domestic+violence+among+rural+Alaska+native+women&amp;rft.au=Shepherd%2C+Judy&amp;rft.aulast=Shepherd&amp;rft.aufirst=Judy&amp;rft.date=2001-12-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=488&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Where+do+you+go+when+it%27s+40+below%3F+Domestic+violence+among+rural+Alaska+native+women&amp;rft.au=Shepherd%2C+Judy&amp;rft.aulast=Shepherd&amp;rft.aufirst=Judy&amp;rft.date=2001-12-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=488&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Environment through a gendered lens: From person-in-environment to woman-in-environment

Author: Kemp, Susan P

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393703?accountid=14667

Abstract: Building on interdisciplinary work by critical and feminist scholars in geography, architecture and urban planning, and history, this aticle prposes a reworking of social work's person-environment formulation to incorporate gender and its implications more fully. Three interlocking domains are addressed: (a) women's subjective experiences of their everyday environments; (b) the connections among these environmental experiences, the geography of women's lives, and larger social categories such as race/ethnicity, class, and sexual orientation; and (c) women's environmental strengths, resources, and agency.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Environment+through+a+gendered+lens%3A+From+person-in-environment+to+woman-in-environment&amp;rft.au=Kemp%2C+Susan+P&amp;rft.aulast=Kemp&amp;rft.aufirst=Susan&amp;rft.date=2001-04-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=7&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Social work academia: Is the glass ceiling beginning to crack?

Author: Di Palma, Sunday L; Topper, Gayle G

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393652?accountid=14667

Abstract: This study assessed the progress made by women in social work education in attaining top-level administrative positions - director of a baccalaureate program and deal or director of a master's degreee program - from 1985 ot 1996. It found taht, unlike higher education in general, social work academia has made significant progress in redressing the gross imbalance of male to female leaders at the undergraduate and graduate levels and could well serve as a model for other disciplines.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Social+work+academia%3A+Is+the+glass+ceiling+beginning+to+crack%3F&amp;rft.au=Di+Palma%2C+Sunday+L%3BTopper%2C+Gayle+G&amp;rft.aulast=Di+Palma&amp;rft.aufirst=Sunday&amp;rft.date=2001-04-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=31&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Stalking: The constant threat of violence

Author: Sinwelski, Shari A; Vinton, Linda

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215399684?accountid=14667

Abstract: All 50 states and the District of Columbia have passed antistalking legislation. This article discusses the history and dynamics of stalking and contemporary efforts to define and regulate stalking behavior, along with interventions for victims and stalkers.

An emancipatory principle for social work with survivors of male violence

Author: Gale Goldberg Wood; Roche, Susan E

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215399603?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article describes a principle to guide direct preactice with survivors of male violence - undermining oppressive beliefs. This principle politicizes what has been explained at the interpersonal level as one man's violence toward one woman and the woman's psychological struggle in its wake.

Taking account of men in the lives of teenage mothers

Author: McKinnon, Margaret; Davies, Linda; Rains, Prue

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389402?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article examines two Canadian social service agencies, both of which are progressive and feminist in their orientation toward teenage mothers. It discussses how the staff and young women view men and considers the possibilities and challenges of working with young women in relation to the men in their lives.

Journeying the quagmire: Exploring the discourses that shape the qualitative research process

Author: O'Connor, Deborah

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390217?accountid=14667

Abstract: In the struggles to have its legitimacy recognized, qualitative research has been framed as a singular entity understood in relation to quantitative research. O'Connor opens the discussion on the implications associated with contradictory discourses around qualitative research.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Journeying+the+quagmire%3A+Exploring+the+discourses+that+shape+the+qualitative+research+process&amp;rft.au=O%27Connor%2C+Deborah&amp;rft.aulast=O%27Connor&amp;rft.aufirst=Deborah&amp;rft.date=2001-07-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=138&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Specific practice strategies for empowerment-based practice with women: A study of two groups

Author: Parsons, Ruth J

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215396880?accountid=14667

Abstract: Although it is commonly agreed in the social work literature that empowerment principles are appropriate and helpful in work with women, it is not always clear how to implement these principles. Parsons presents the qualitative study of two groups--a political advocacy group and a group for survivors of domestic violence--that identified specific behaviors of social workers and experiences of clients that facilitate the empowerment of women.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Specific+practice+strategies+for+empowerment-based+practice+with+women%3A+A+study+of+two+groups&amp;rft.au=Parsons%2C+Ruth+J&amp;rft.aulast=Parsons&amp;rft.aufirst=Ruth&amp;rft.date=2001-07-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=159&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Specific+practice+strategies+for+empowerment-based+practice+with+women%3A+A+study+of+two+groups&amp;rft.au=Parsons%2C+Ruth+J&amp;rft.aulast=Parsons&amp;rft.aufirst=Ruth&amp;rft.date=2001-07-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=159&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Subject: Social work; Women; Studies; Behavior; Professional relationships

Title: Specific practice strategies for empowerment-based practice with women: A study of two groups

Publication title: Affilia

Volume: 16

____________________________________________________________

Economic advocacy for survivors of domestic violence

Author: Kok, Anne C

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215402272?accountid=14667

Abstract: With great uncertainty about the effects of the federal welfare reform law on survivors of domestic violence, researchers and activists have recommended that domestic violence program staff work closely with welfare workers in implementing new policies. Kok describes the collaboration between a Wisconsin domestic violence shelter and a county welfare program in providing direct services to survivors who need economic assistance.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Economic+advocacy+for+survivors+of+domestic+violence&amp;rft.au=Kok%2C+Anne+C&amp;rft.aulast=Kok&amp;rft.aufirst=Anne&amp;rft.date=2001-07-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=180&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Resilience among women survivors of child sexual abuse

Author: Hyman, Batya; Williams, Linda

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215396447?accountid=14667

Abstract: Research has paid little attention to survivors of childhood sexual abuse who do not exhibit long-term negative consequences or who manifest resilience. Hyman and Williams investigate resilient outcomes and the factors associated with these outcomes in 136 women who were sexually abused as children.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Resilience+among+women+survivors+of+child+sexual+abuse&amp;rft.au=Hyman%2C+Batya%3BWilliams%2C+Linda&amp;rft.aulast=Hyman&amp;rft.aufirst=Batya&amp;rft.date=2001-07-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=198&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Redefining abuse of women with disabilities: A paradox of limitation and expansion

Author: Stephen French Gilson; Cramer, Elizabeth P; DePoy, Elizabeth

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393557?accountid=14667

Abstract: Gilson, Cramer, and DePoy present a study that examined the experiences of abused women with disabilities and the women's use of and need for services and resources. They found that although disabled and nondisabled women face many of the same forms of abuse, disabled women have unique experiences that require specialized services.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Redefining+abuse+of+women+with+disabilities%3A+A+paradox+of+limitation+and+expansion&amp;rft.au=Stephen+French+Gilson%3BCramer%2C+Elizabeth+P%3BDePoy%2C+Elizabeth&amp;rft.aulast=Stephen+French+Gilson&amp;rft.aufirst=&amp;rft.date=2001-07-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=220&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Social Work, Women, and Feminism: A Review of Social Work Journals, 1988-1997

Author: Barretti, Marietta11 SocialWork Program, Long Island University,C.W. Post Campus, Brookville, NY, mbarrett@optonline.net

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/811227551?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article surveys articles containing women's content that were published in 17 social work journals from 1988 to 1997. It discusses the journals in which content on women was most and least likely to appear, which social roles were most frequently used to depict women, which themes pertaining to women captured the most attention, which social work curricular areas were most frequently mentioned, and which analytical methods were used. Moreover, it determines the extent to which the articles were feminist or reflected a variation of feminism.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Social+Work%2C+Women%2C+and+Feminism%3A+A+Review+of+Social+Work+Journals%2C+1988-1997&amp;rft.au=Barretti%2C+Marietta&amp;rft.aulast=Barretti&amp;rft.aufirst=Marietta&amp;rft.date=2001-08-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=266&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1177%2F088610990101600302

____________________________________________________________

Empowering women through computer-mediated class participation

Author: Gasker, Janice A; Cascio, Toni

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215398790?accountid=14667

Abstract: A voluntary e-mail communication project and a survey of students' perceptions of the project were conducted among students in an introductory social work course. The students reported positive effects on learning and on their relationships with peers and the instructor.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Empowering+women+through+computer-mediated+class+participation&amp;rft.au=Gasker%2C+Janice+A%3BCascio%2C+Toni&amp;rft.aulast=Gasker&amp;rft.aufirst=Janice&amp;rft.date=2001-10-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=295&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Rights, responsibility, and relationship: Motivations for women's social activism

Author: Faver, Catherine A

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215396793?accountid=14667

Abstract: A narrative analysis of interviews with 50 women who were working for social change as professionals or volunteers revealed three motivations for activism: (a) to ensure rights, (b) to fulfill responsibilities, and (c) to restore relationships and build community. The three motivations reflect a modified ethic of care, which includes concern for distant and unfamiliar others.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Rights%2C+responsibility%2C+and+relationship%3A+Motivations+for+women%27s+social+activism&amp;rft.au=Faver%2C+Catherine+A&amp;rft.aulast=Faver&amp;rft.aufirst=Catherine&amp;rft.date=2001-10-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=314&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Rights%2C+responsibility%2C+and+relationship%3A+Motivations+for+women%27s+social+activism&amp;rft.au=Faver%2C+Catherine+A&amp;rft.aulast=Faver&amp;rft.aufirst=Catherine&amp;rft.date=2001-10-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=314&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Never mind the law: Legal discourse and rape reform in Israel

Author: Ajzenstadt, Mimi; Steinberg, Odeda

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389990?accountid=14667

Abstract: In 1988, Israel changed its rape laws, inflicting harsher penalties on convicted rapists. Using quantitative and qualitative method, this study compared punishment meted out before and after the reform and content analyzed the judicial discourse created in the courts in both periods.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Never+mind+the+law%3A+Legal+discourse+and+rape+reform+in+Israel&amp;rft.au=Ajzenstadt%2C+Mimi%3BSteinberg%2C+Odeda&amp;rft.aulast=Ajzenstadt&amp;rft.aufirst=Mimi&amp;rft.date=2001-10-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=337&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Never+mind+the+law%3A+Legal+discourse+and+rape+reform+in+Israel&amp;rft.au=Ajzenstadt%2C+Mimi%3BSteinberg%2C+Odeda&amp;rft.aulast=Ajzenstadt&amp;rft.aufirst=Mimi&amp;rft.date=2001-10-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=337&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

"Creating a little mischief": A portrait of Mildred Jeffrey's 65 years as an activist

Author: Alvarez, Ann Rosegrant

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215380991?accountid=14667

Abstract: Mildred Jeffrey has contributed significantly to the labor movement, the civil rights movement, and the women's movement. Her many years of commitment to major U.S. social movements, coupled with her vital personality and indefatigable energy, have resulted in both an impressive list of accomplishments and increasing public recognition.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=%22Creating+a+little+mischief%22%3A+A+portrait+of+Mildred+Jeffrey%27s+65+years+as+an+activist&amp;rft.au=Alvarez%2C+Ann+Rosegrant&amp;rft.aulast=Alvarez&amp;rft.aufirst=Ann&amp;rft.date=2001-10-01&amp;rft.volume=16&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=360&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Negotiating images: Popular culture, imagination, and hope in clinical social work practice

Author: Beres, Laura

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215390926?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article discusses the findings of a study of reflective clinical social work practice with women who had experienced wife assault. Literature, practice, and research suggest that it may be beneficial to examine, within the therapeutic setting, clients' engagement with popular cultural texts and what they have learned form them. Through the process of engaging women in reflecting on their learning sites and negotiating images within their favorite popular cultural texts, it also became clear that it would be necessary to examine conceptions of hope. Thus, approaches to addressing hope within practice are also discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Negotiating+images%3A+Popular+culture%2C+imagination%2C+and+hope+in+clinical+social+work+practice&amp;rft.au=Beres%2C+Laura&amp;rft.aulast=Beres&amp;rft.aufirst=Laura&amp;rft.date=2002-12-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=429&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Negotiating+images%3A+Popular+culture%2C+imagination%2C+and+hope+in+clinical+social+work+practice&amp;rft.au=Beres%2C+Laura&amp;rft.aulast=Beres&amp;rft.aufirst=Laura&amp;rft.date=2002-12-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=429&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Raices: Gender-conscious community building in Santiago, Chile

Author: Finn, Janet L

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389260?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article discusses the history, activities, contributions, and challenges of Raices, a women's collective based in Santiago, Chile, whose participants promote community change through popular education. The article explores the philosophical foundations of Raices and locates the collective in its political and historical contexts. Particular attention is paid to the ways in which Raices has confronted the tensions and contradictions of emergent democracy in a neoliberal economy, officialist feminism in state-sanctioned women's organizations, and everyday life for poor and working-class women who are marginalized by both. The implications for feminist social work practice are addressed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Raices%3A+Gender-conscious+community+building+in+Santiago%2C+Chile&amp;rft.au=Finn%2C+Janet+L&amp;rft.aulast=Finn&amp;rft.aufirst=Janet&amp;rft.date=2002-12-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=448&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Raices%3A+Gender-conscious+community+building+in+Santiago%2C+Chile&amp;rft.au=Finn%2C+Janet+L&amp;rft.aulast=Finn&amp;rft.aufirst=Janet&amp;rft.date=2002-12-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=448&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Negotiating intimacies in a globalized space: Identity and cohesion in young Oromo refugee women

Author: Kumsa, Martha Kuwee

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215385469?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article explores the paradoxical processes in how young Oromo refugee women negotiate identity and cohesion in a globalized space. It argues that these women's experiences reveal the interplay of local and global forces of identity and cohesion. The myth that contemporary migration has diversified and expanded the pool from which people choose intimate partners is challenged, and the multiple boundaries of gender, race, class, sexuality, ethnicity, and nationality interweaving in this pool of choice are critically analyzed. Implications for feminist social work practice are discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Negotiating+intimacies+in+a+globalized+space%3A+Identity+and+cohesion+in+young+Oromo+refugee+women&amp;rft.au=Kumsa%2C+Martha+Kuwee&amp;rft.aulast=Kumsa&amp;rft.aufirst=Martha&amp;rft.date=2002-12-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=471&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Fuerza Unida

Author: Finn, Janet L

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215380549?accountid=14667

Abstract: On Jan 17, 1990, the Levi Strauss plant in San Antonio closed with no warning. With the help of the Southwest Public Workers Union, the women affected by the closure formed Fuerza Unida (United Force) to fight for their rights as workers and women. Over the past decade, Fuerza Unida has developed into a formidable organization that contributes to meaningful change in women's lives.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Fuerza+Unida&amp;rft.au=Finn%2C+Janet+L&amp;rft.aulast=Finn&amp;rft.aufirst=Janet&amp;rft.date=2002-12-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=497&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Fuerza+Unida&amp;rft.au=Finn%2C+Janet+L&amp;rft.aulast=Finn&amp;rft.aufirst=Janet&amp;rft.date=2002-12-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=497&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Adding legal insult to injury: Battered women, their children, and the failure to protect

Author: Kopels, Sandra; Marcie Chesnut Sheridan

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215385733?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article examines reported appellate cases from various jurisdictions in which battered mothers did not abuse their children but were penalized for their partners' abusive conduct in light of the underlying dynamics of domestic violence. It presents recommendations for increased collaboration, cooperation, and understanding between those who work with persons who are experiencing domestic violence and those who work with abused children.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Adding+legal+insult+to+injury%3A+Battered+women%2C+their+children%2C+and+the+failure+to+protect&amp;rft.au=Kopels%2C+Sandra%3BMarcie+Chesnut+Sheridan&amp;rft.aulast=Kopels&amp;rft.aufirst=Sandra&amp;rft.date=2002-04-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=9&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Adding+legal+insult+to+injury%3A+Battered+women%2C+their+children%2C+and+the+failure+to+protect&amp;rft.au=Kopels%2C+Sandra%3BMarcie+Chesnut+Sheridan&amp;rft.aulast=Kopels&amp;rft.aufirst=Sandra&amp;rft.date=2002-04-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=9&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Something worth fighting for: Higher education for women on welfare

Author: Butler, Sandra S; Deprez, Luisa

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215396197?accountid=14667

Abstract: The passage of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act (PRWORA) restricted access to postsecondary education for women on welfare. This article discusses the consequences of this aspect of PRWORA and the effect of higher education on women on welfare.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Something+worth+fighting+for%3A+Higher+education+for+women+on+welfare&amp;rft.au=Butler%2C+Sandra+S%3BDeprez%2C+Luisa&amp;rft.aulast=Butler&amp;rft.aufirst=Sandra&amp;rft.date=2002-04-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=30&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

The PTSD diagnosis: Is it good for women?

Author: Berg, Susan H

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389826?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article discusses the feminist response to the diagnosis of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), which is used to identify and treat the psychological symptoms of women who have been sexually and physically abused.

____________________________________________________________

Reflections on a rape trial: The role of rape myths and jury selection in the outcome of a trial

Author: Shepherd, Judy

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215398446?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article reviews arguments and jury deliberations from a rape trial that took place in spring 1999 and was retried 7 months later. It presents the circumstances of the case, the evidence and arguments of the prosecution and defense, discussions among jurors during the first trial, and the outcome of each trial.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Reflections+on+a+rape+trial%3A+The+role+of+rape+myths+and+jury+selection+in+the+outcome+of+a+trial&amp;rft.au=Shepherd%2C+Judy&amp;rft.aulast=Shepherd&amp;rft.aufirst=Judy&amp;rft.date=2002-04-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=69&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Race and the politics of personal relationships: Focus on black Canadian women

Author: Tastsoglou, Evangelia

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215398624?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article critically reviews the literature on racism (White and internalized Black) in the heterosexual relationships of Black women. In addition, it assesses the relevance of this literature to Canadian Black women, identifies the research gaps on the subject, and maps out an empirical agenda for research on Black Canadian heterosexual relationships, premised on an integrated feminist, antiracist, and class-based analytical perspective.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Race+and+the+politics+of+personal+relationships%3A+Focus+on+black+Canadian+women&amp;rft.au=Tastsoglou%2C+Evangelia&amp;rft.aulast=Tastsoglou&amp;rft.aufirst=Evangelia&amp;rft.date=2002-04-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.spage=93&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Sexism and the social work curriculum: A content analysis of the Journal of Social Work Education

Author: Grise-Owens, Erlene

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215391174?accountid=14667

Abstract: Grise-Owens conducted an inductive study to explore whether social work education offers a gender-equitable curriculum according to the Curriculum Policy Statement of the Council on Social Work Education. Specifically, the study asked whether the "Journal of Social Work Education," as representative of social work education, addresses gender issues routinely, systematically and without bias in its articles.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Sexism+and+the+social+work+curriculum%3A+A+content+analysis+of+the+Journal+of+Social+Work+Education&amp;rft.au=Grise-Owens%2C+Erlene&amp;rft.aulast=Grise-Owens&amp;rft.aufirst=Erlene&amp;rft.date=2002-07-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=147&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Sisterhood is not enough: The invisibility of mothering in shelter practice with battered women

Author: Krane, Julia; Davies, Linda

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215380720?accountid=14667

Abstract: Krane and Davies critically analyze feminist practice in shelters for battered women, with particular attention to the extent to which issues of mothering are addressed. An articulation of some of the consequences of the invisibility of women as mothers in shelter settings and suggested implications for shelter practice are presented.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Sisterhood+is+not+enough%3A+The+invisibility+of+mothering+in+shelter+practice+with+battered+women&amp;rft.au=Krane%2C+Julia%3BDavies%2C+Linda&amp;rft.aulast=Krane&amp;rft.aufirst=Julia&amp;rft.date=2002-07-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=167&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Reflections on the art of social work practice: A metaphor from the drawing of a swan

Author: Palmer, Nancie

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215399016?accountid=14667

Abstract: Palmer relates an experience she had as a graduate student in social work in practicum at a mental health clinic. Palmer discusses her surprise when a troubled adolescent, in response to the "draw a person" approach, drew the picture of a swan. Palmer examines the prevailing epistemology that limits explanation and validation of the art of practice and the practice of art making.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Reflections+on+the+art+of+social+work+practice%3A+A+metaphor+from+the+drawing+of+a+swan&amp;rft.au=Palmer%2C+Nancie&amp;rft.aulast=Palmer&amp;rft.aufirst=Nancie&amp;rft.date=2002-07-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=191&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Living in a bicultural world and finding the way home: Native women's stories

Author: Barrios, Patricia G; Egan, Marcia

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393327?accountid=14667

Abstract: Four Native American women living in the majority culture were interviewed in a qualitative study to explore their experiences concerning the meaning of being Native and of being Native women. A constant comparative qualitative analysis revealed four themes reflecting the women's experiences: "otherness"; conflicting dominant and Native cultural messages; Native traditions as strengths, particularly as taught by female elders early in life; and the formation of positive gender and ethnic identities.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Living+in+a+bicultural+world+and+finding+the+way+home%3A+Native+women%27s+stories&amp;rft.au=Barrios%2C+Patricia+G%3BEgan%2C+Marcia&amp;rft.aulast=Barrios&amp;rft.aufirst=Patricia&amp;rft.date=2002-07-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=206&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

A feminist approach to practice in working with midlife and older women with HIV/AIDS

Author: Emlet, Charles A; Tangenberg, Katy; Siverson, Claire

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215388838?accountid=14667

Abstract: Older women with HIV/AIDS constitute an invisible population that is often ignored. Emlet et al explore the importance of a feminist approach to practice with a population affected by the intersection of ageism, sexism, and AIDS phobia. A support group for midlife and older women with HIV/AIDS is described, and four themes that were identified by group participants are discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=A+feminist+approach+to+practice+in+working+with+midlife+and+older+women+with+HIV%2FAIDS&amp;rft.au=Emlet%2C+Charles+A%3BTangenberg%2C+Katy%3BSiverson%2C+Claire&amp;rft.aulast=Emlet&amp;rft.aufirst=Charles&amp;rft.date=2002-07-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.spage=229&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

My Story and Perceptions as I Remember Them

Author: Jaipaul, Inderjit11 School Social Administration, Temple U, Philadelphia, PA jjaipaul@aol.com

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/61446038?accountid=14667

Abstract: On receiving the Lifetime Achievement Award from the PA chapter of the National Assoc of Social Workers (NASW), Jaipul shares her life history -- from her childhood in India to her present role at Temple U in PA -- & how she became involved in social work & the NASW. Jaipul discusses the obstacles she overcame while fighting for her own rights as well as the rights of women in general. A. Lee

____________________________________________________________

Progress or complacency? Pay equity for women circa 2001

Author: Gibelman, Margaret

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215396305?accountid=14667

Abstract: Gibelman explores the issue of women's pay in social work within a comparative framework of several other service occupations. A secondary analysis of US Department of Labor, Bureau of Labor Statistics, data on wages and earnings revealed that substantial salary discrepancies on the basis of gender continue to exist throughout the service professions.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Progress+or+complacency%3F+Pay+equity+for+women+circa+2001&amp;rft.au=Gibelman%2C+Margaret&amp;rft.aulast=Gibelman&amp;rft.aufirst=Margaret&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=279&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Progress+or+complacency%3F+Pay+equity+for+women+circa+2001&amp;rft.au=Gibelman%2C+Margaret&amp;rft.aulast=Gibelman&amp;rft.aufirst=Margaret&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=279&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Subject: Sex discrimination; Income inequality; Women; Wages & salaries; Social work

Title: Progress or complacency? Pay equity for women circa 2001

____________________________________________________________

Prenatal care for women who are addicted: Implications for gender-sensitive practice

Author: Carter, Carolyn S

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215391006?accountid=14667

Abstract: Carter examines legal and gender-sensitive interventions for prenatal drug abuse and the greater benefits that accrue to women when gender-sensitive approaches are used. The author also discusses the disparate use of legal proceedings against poor women and women of color, pejorative attitudes and behaviors of prenatal health workers who compromise their relationship with women who are addicted, and sexist practices that place mothers who use drugs more at risk of legal interventions in health care settings than fathers who are addicted.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Prenatal+care+for+women+who+are+addicted%3A+Implications+for+gender-sensitive+practice&amp;rft.au=Carter%2C+Carolyn+S&amp;rft.aulast=Carter&amp;rft.aufirst=Carolyn&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=299&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Prenatal+care+for+women+who+are+addicted%3A+Implications+for+gender-sensitive+practice&amp;rft.au=Carter%2C+Carolyn+S&amp;rft.aulast=Carter&amp;rft.aufirst=Carolyn&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=299&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Unraveling a relationship: Single motherhood and the practices of public housing

Author: Lessa, Iara

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389480?accountid=14667

Abstract: The prevalence of mother-led families in public housing is widely recognized, yet the relationship between this form of social program and single motherhood has not received sufficient critical analysis. Exploring this relationship but departing from previous studies, Lessa discusses a study that focused on the management practices of public housing during its period of expansion in Ontario, Canada.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Unraveling+a+relationship%3A+Single+motherhood+and+the+practices+of+public+housing&amp;rft.au=Lessa%2C+Iara&amp;rft.aulast=Lessa&amp;rft.aufirst=Iara&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=314&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Women, work, and occupational segregation in the uniformed services

Author: Grube-Farrell, Beth

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215389545?accountid=14667

Abstract: Occupational segregation is one of many reasons why women who move from welfare to employment fail to achieve self-sufficiency. It is particularly acute in occupations such as the uniformed services, where women continue to be underrepresented, largely as a result of such barriers as bias, stereotyping, hostile workplace cultures, and lack of adequate supervision. The role of social work in addressing these problems is discussed.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women%2C+work%2C+and+occupational+segregation+in+the+uniformed+services&amp;rft.au=Grube-Farrell%2C+Beth&amp;rft.aulast=Grube-Farrell&amp;rft.aufirst=Beth&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=332&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

Older homeless women: Reframing the stereotype of the bag lady

Author: Kisor, Anne J; Kendal-Wilson, Lynne

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393121?accountid=14667

Abstract: Economic and social factors contribute to the growing number of older homeless women and the risk of their displacement. A study is presented that reframes the stereotype of the bag lady to allow fruitful analyses of these women's plight and need for services.

____________________________________________________________

Warring on Women: Understanding Complex Inequalities of Gender, Race, Class, and Nation

Author: Okazawa-Rey, Margo11 School Social Work, San Francisco State U, CA mor@sfsu.edu

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/61529017?accountid=14667

Abstract: Considers the dehumanization involved in military conflict, the crimes against women committed by military personnel, the casualties to civilians involved in fighting high-tech wars, & the implicit responsibility that each citizen bears for the actions of its government. US citizens, even the most marginalized, reap benefits from US hegemony, &, therefore, bear responsibility to work for peaceful solutions to world problems. The author argues for the end of the war in Afghanistan & its rebuilding with democratic structures that involve women; the repeal of the USA PATRIOT Act of 2001 that seriously imperils civil liberties & human rights; the release of hundreds of terrorist suspects; US participation in international courts, such as the International Criminal Court; & the investment of military expenditures into rebuilding America's infrastructure. 22 References. L. A. Hoffman

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Warring+on+Women%3A+Understanding+Complex+Inequalities+of+Gender%2C+Race%2C+Class%2C+and+Nation&amp;rft.au=Okazawa-Rey%2C+Margo&amp;rft.aulast=Okazawa-Rey&amp;rft.aufirst=Margo&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=371&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Warring+on+Women%3A+Understanding+Complex+Inequalities+of+Gender%2C+Race%2C+Class%2C+and+Nation&amp;rft.au=Okazawa-Rey%2C+Margo&amp;rft.aulast=Okazawa-Rey&amp;rft.aufirst=Margo&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=371&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Women of conscience: Jeannette Rankin and Barbara Lee

Author: Barbara Levy Simon

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215393171?accountid=14667

Abstract: In the spirit of Rep Jeannette P. Rankin, who was the sole person to vote against the entry of the US into WWI and WWII, in Sep 2001, Rep Barbara Lee was the only elected official in Congress to cast a dissenting vote against granting Pres Bush unrestricted use of military force in Afghanistan in the wake of the terrorist attacks of Sep 11. Although they were women of different generations and circumstances, they nonetheless were willing to walk a solitary path of principle in the face of condemnation.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women+of+conscience%3A+Jeannette+Rankin+and+Barbara+Lee&amp;rft.au=Barbara+Levy+Simon&amp;rft.aulast=Barbara+Levy+Simon&amp;rft.aufirst=&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=384&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Women+of+conscience%3A+Jeannette+Rankin+and+Barbara+Lee&amp;rft.au=Barbara+Levy+Simon&amp;rft.aulast=Barbara+Levy+Simon&amp;rft.aufirst=&amp;rft.date=2002-10-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.spage=384&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Constructing Learning Sites for Solidarity and Social Action: Gender Autobiography for Consciousness Raising

Author: Comerford, Susan A1; Fambrough, Mary J1 Department of Social Work, University of Vermont, 443 Waterman Building, 85 South Prospect Street, Burlington, VT 05405-0160

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/811227691?accountid=14667

Abstract: This article reports on the use of gender autobiography as a tool and process in courses on women's issues and human behavior in the social environment. The authors argue that despite political, social, and economic advances made by women, inequities persist, and collective action toward their amelioration has been inhibited by women's lack of understanding of and appreciation for the diversity of their experiences and contexts. The use of the gender autobiography heightens appreciation for diversity by deconstructing essentializing notions of gender while enabling the reconstruction of relationships of solidarity among women through the discovery of commonalities of experience under patriarchy. Thus, effective participation in the feminist project becomes possible.

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Constructing+Learning+Sites+for+Solidarity+and+Social+Action%3A+Gender+Autobiography+for+Consciousness+Raising&amp;rft.au=Comerford%2C+Susan+A%3BFambrough%2C+Mary+J&amp;rft.aulast=Comerford&amp;rft.aufirst=Susan&amp;rft.date=2002-11-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=411&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1177%2F088610902237359

http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Asocialservicesshell&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Constructing+Learning+Sites+for+Solidarity+and+Social+Action%3A+Gender+Autobiography+for+Consciousness+Raising&amp;rft.au=Comerford%2C+Susan+A%3BFambrough%2C+Mary+J&amp;rft.aulast=Comerford&amp;rft.aufirst=Susan&amp;rft.date=2002-11-01&amp;rft.volume=17&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=411&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/10.1177%2F088610902237359

____________________________________________________________

Linking feminist social work and feminist theology in light of faith-based service initiatives

Author: Tangenberg, Kathleen M

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215392332?accountid=14667

Abstract: Feminist theology and feminist social work share similar values, social concerns, and institutional challenges, although interdisciplinary dialogue is rarely described in the professional literature. This article discusses the relevance of feminist theology to feminist social work, using narratives of women in faith-based service communities to identify common domains of practice and philosophy. Historical and contemporary narratives are discussed in light of the growing support for faith-based service initiatives and the likelihood of further collaborations between professional social work and religious nonprofit organizations. Discussion includes attention to issues of difference/diversity and multiple challenges posed by decreased public funding for social services.[PUBLICATION ABSTRACT]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Linking+feminist+social+work+and+feminist+theology+in+light+of+faith-based+service+initiatives&amp;rft.au=Tangenberg%2C+Kathleen+M&amp;rft.aulast=Tangenberg&amp;rft.aufirst=Kathleen&amp;rft.date=2003-12-01&amp;rft.volume=18&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=379&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/

____________________________________________________________

Gender biases in child welfare

Author: Risley-Curtiss, Christina; Heffernan, Kristin

http://proxy.lib.umich.edu/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/215397709?accountid=14667

Abstract: Gender biases are pervasive in child welfare research and practice. Although these biases have been addressed to some extent in the literature, there continues to be a lack of information on fathers and an overrepresentation of information on mothers, and thus the biases continue. This article explores how these biases are currently manifested in both research and practice and makes recommendations for changes in research, policy, and practice. [PUBLICATION ABSTRACT]

Links: http://mgetit.lib.umich.edu/?ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_enc=info:ofi/enc:UTF-8&amp;rfr_id=info:sid/ProQ%3Apqrl&amp;rft_val_fmt=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:journal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Affilia&amp;rft.atitle=Gender+biases+in+child+welfare&amp;rft.au=Risley-Curtiss%2C+Christina%3BHeffernan%2C+Kristin&amp;rft.aulast=Risley-Curtiss&amp;rft.aufirst=Christina&amp;rft.date=2003-12-01&amp;rft.volume=18&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.spage=395&amp;rft.isbn=&amp;rft.btitle=&amp;rft.title=Affilia&amp;rft.issn=08861099&amp;rft_id=info:doi/
